intro: Mormodes ocanae var. brachylobum, commonly known as the short-stemmed orchid, is a rare and delicate plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structures. The plant typically features small, lance-shaped leaves and produces fragrant, showy flowers in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires careful cultivation due to its specific ecological needs. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role in its native ecosystem.
